flags.osa_signal: Possible signs of sleep apnea – consider talking to your doctor.
flags.excessive_sleepiness: Marked daytime sleepiness – be extra careful.

pattern.keep_routine: Keep a stable sleep routine – similar bed and wake times most days.
pattern.short_naps: If you need a nap, keep it short (20–30 min) and earlier in the day.
pattern.consistent_bed_wake: Aim for consistent bed and wake times (±30–60 min).
pattern.plan_winddown: Create a simple wind-down routine 30–60 min before bed (dim lights, low-stim activities).
pattern.protect_7h: Protect a sleep window of at least 7 hours most nights.
pattern.cut_late_naps: Avoid long or late naps after ~3–4 pm – they can delay night sleep.

insomnia.maintain: Maintain what already works – small, steady habits add up.
insomnia.rule_20min: If awake ~20 min in bed: get up, do something calm in low light, and try again.
insomnia.fixed_wake: Keep a fixed wake time regardless – it trains your body clock.
insomnia.stimulus_control: Reserve bed for sleep and intimacy only – not TV, phone, or work.
insomnia.consider_cbti: If problems persist: consider CBT-I (cognitive behavioral therapy for insomnia).

quality.track_triggers: Track potential triggers (caffeine, workout timing, stress) to spot patterns.
quality.address_disruptors: Reduce common disruptors (noise, light, discomfort, late screen time).
quality.consult_if_pain: Persistent pain, restlessness, or nightmares? Consult a clinician.

daytime.morning_light: Get morning light (10–30 min) to boost alertness and anchor your circadian rhythm.
daytime.activity_breaks: Take brief movement breaks across the day; schedule light activity earlier in the evening.
daytime.consider_medical: Marked daytime sleepiness? Consider a medical check (e.g., sleep apnea or other causes).

hygiene.keep_it_up: Keep up the sleep-supportive habits that already help.
hygiene.screens_off_60: Go screen-light or screen-free for the last 60 minutes before bed.
hygiene.limit_caffeine: Avoid caffeine after ~2–4 pm (6–8 hours before bedtime).
hygiene.no_alcohol_late: Skip alcohol close to bedtime – it fragments sleep.
hygiene.no_big_meals_late: Avoid large, heavy meals right before bed; choose a light snack if needed.

environment.keep_cool_dark: Keep the bedroom cool, dark, and uncluttered – make the bed a sleep cue.
environment.test_blackout: Try blackout shades/eye mask and dim evening lighting.
environment.noise_control: Tame noise (earplugs, white noise, steady background sound) if needed.
environment.try_new_pillow: Evaluate pillow/mattress – replace if you wake with discomfort.
environment.cooler_temp: Lower temperature or use lighter bedding if you overheat at night.

breathing.side_sleep: Try side-sleeping (use a pillow behind your back) – may reduce snoring/apneas for some.
breathing.reduce_evening_alcohol: Avoid evening alcohol – it can worsen snoring/breathing issues.
breathing.consider_gp_check: Suspect sleep apnea (loud snoring, witnessed pauses, daytime tiredness)? See your doctor.
